name: Flix The Flea
description: Inspired by the 8-bit classics and with a host of challenging environments and features - Flix The flea is the high flying platformer from one-man game studio, Psychotic Psoftware.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: 2.40GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Standard Storage: 80 MB available space Sound Card: Standard

reviews.review_text: So you jump a lot. Until you get the hang of how much jump to appy you miss 99% of the time.   Pro: Steam cards Great for little kids In bundles Once you get the hang of it, it's fairly easy   Con: No steam overlay - had to bypass to get screen shots Was actually a 1983 game. Not sure if this is a rip-off or a remake $3.29 (CDN) LOL Not much to this game   Overall: 5/10 -1 price -1 'remake' -1 not much to it +1 kid friendly +1 steam cards = 4/10 Get this game free in a bundle or when it's $0.50 or less This is a kill 10 min casual game. Don't expect Witcher 3.  Steam you need a thumbs sideways.  Thumbs up since I got it in a bundle for next to nothing and I could have sold the cards for a profit.
I have now played the game, i opened it and pressed esc, it closed the game and steam still says im playing. 10/10 recommended without playing yet.
This game is terrible!!!  10/10 funny game
Cross between platformer and golfing: the longer you press left or right, the stronger your jump will be. Since that's all you do, expect to miss a lot of jumps at first. I gave up on it.
Got if for free and still feeling like ripped off. 0/10

This game is empty, you keep jumping your way up that's all and the controls are terrible, decent graphics with good sounds, the only good thing about this game it has trading cards.  ▂▃▅▇█  final judgement : 40/100  █▇▅▃▂

1/10 - Really Bad Flea Sim  This just isn't fun. It should be free or not played. Controls are wonky. You can only jump left or right, controlling the power of your jump with a power meter. The controls are good enough to make this enjoyable. The game really doesn't have much substance either.   Should be free. Or never created.     Accidently Reviewed
